name: Exploring dependence between categorical variables: Benefits and limitations of using variable selection within Bayesian clustering in relation to log-linear modelling with interaction terms
abstraction: Given a positive, normalized kernel and a finite measure on an Euclidean space, we construct a random density by convoluting the kernel with the Dirichlet random probability indexed by the finite measure. The posterior distribution of the random density given a sample is classified. The Bayes estimator of the density function is given.
